intro: Oncostemum fuscopilosum, commonly known as the black-haired oncostemum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
